Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CATHPb4 (cathelicidins; natural AMPs; snake, reptiles, animals; Arg-rich 31%;  UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 39% similarity toAs-CATH6. molecular formula: C197H293N55O37; Mol Wt: 4032.812; GRAVY = -1.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC25923 or MRSA (MIC 18.75 ug/mL), S. epidermidis (MIC 18.75 ug/mL), N. asteroids (MIC 9.38 ug/ml), B. cereus (MIC 9.38 ug/ml), E. faecalis IS 981 (MIC 37.5 ug/mL), E. faecium IS 1299 (MIC 18.75 ug/mL), Gram- E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 18.75 ug/ml), K. oxytoca (MIC 18.75 ug/ml) , S. paratyphi IS 738 (MIC 37.5 ug/ml), D. bacillus (MIC 4.69 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 18.75-37.5 ug/ml), S. maltophilia (MIC 18.75 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 9.38-18.75 ug/ml), and fungi C. albicans (MIC 9.38-18.75 ug/mL) and C. glabrata (MIC 9.38-18.75 ug/ml).Toxicity:  hRBC: 65.59% at 100 ug/ml. UPdated 5/2023
Literature Information.Author: Cai S, Qiao X, Feng L, Shi N, Wang H, Yang H, Guo Z, Wang M, Chen Y, Wang Y, Yu H.2018
Literature Information.Title: Python Cathelicidin CATHPb1 Protects against Multidrug-Resistant Staphylococcal Infections by Antimicrobial-Immunomodulatory Duality.
